meanings.definition: A person who does not believe in something.
meanings.sent1: The disbeliever shook their head in disagreement.
meanings.sent2: The disbeliever refused to accept the new theory.
meanings.sent3: The disbeliever thought the idea of flying pigs was too silly.
meanings.sent4: She was a disbeliever in magic until she saw the rabbit disappear.

meanings.definition: To reject or refuse to believe in something.
meanings.sent1: He would disbeliever any news that seemed too good to be true.
meanings.sent2: She tends to disbeliever stories that sound exaggerated.
meanings.sent3: The cat seemed to disbeliever the mouse's promises of friendship.
meanings.sent4: The detective had to disbeliever the suspect's alibi.
meanings.sent5: The child would disbeliever any excuse for not eating vegetables.
